page.title: 08LANGUAGE IN STANLEY
page.content: The STANLEY dialect is harsh to people from other areas.Pronunciation of vowels is often undifferentiated e.g.flat,grass,bat_the "a" is identical put,cup,shut_the"u"is identical. been and being , they and there_are often indistinguishable in speech. "r" is hardly pronounced at all,except as a useful sound to slide from one word to another:"Where did he gerrit?" means "Where did he get it ?" However "work" is pronounced "walk" and "walk"is pronounced "waak". There are few genuine dialect words evident. a"netty"is a toilet,but most people call it a "bog". "snaggas"are turnips,"canny"means good pleasant,nice. The most striking feature of the language is its ideolect. cont.
